org.svvrl.goal.core.draw

Class IdleDrawer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.draw.AbstractDrawer
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.draw.IdleDrawer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the object to be drawn
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MSStateInfoDrawer, PitermanStateInfoDrawer, SafraStateInfoDrawer, ScheweStateInfoDrawer, StateInfoDrawer

    public abstract class IdleDrawer<T>
extends AbstractDrawer
    This is an abstract drawer that draws information about an object at a suggested location within a specific visible area when the cursor stops on the object for a while.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IdleDrawer(T obj, int x, int y, java.awt.Rectangle r)
      Constructs this drawer to display the information of a specified object at a specified location within a specified visible area.

      Draws the background for a specified display area.
      protected T getObject()
      Returns the object with information to be displayed by this drawer.
      protected java.awt.Rectangle getVisible()
      Returns the whole visible area.
      protected int getX()
      Returns the x coordinate of the upper left location for displaying the object.
      protected int getY()
      Returns the y coordinate of the upper left location for displaying the object
      protected void moveToVisible(java.awt.Rectangle display)
      Tries to move the object display area such that it does not go outside the whole visible area.
